snippet: The N.H.L. owners’ proposal, the first significant movement in the negotiations since the lockout began, would preserve an 82-game season starting Nov. 2.
abstract: NHL, eager to end the lockout and play a full 82-game season, offers a 50-50 revenue split with the NHL Players’ Assn and a mechanism guaranteeing that current contracts will be honored.
lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. owners’ proposal, the first significant movement in the negotiations since the lockout began, would preserve an 82-game season starting Nov. 2.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Offers Players a 50-50 Split of Revenue
headline.main: N.H.L. Offers Players a 50-50 Division of Revenue
headline.print_headline: N.H.L. Offers Players a 50-50 Division of Revenue
